result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Carter on 10/27/2022
Hearing on November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:01 AM Defendant Lewis H Sims-Brown in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 

Defendant filed Petition for appointment of counsel on 10/17/2022. Clerk continues efforts to appoint counsel for the Defendant.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed by Lewis H Sims-Brown
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Corrected activity type.

8:55 AM Defendant Lewis H Sims-Brown in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Court had previously stayed a capias. Court quashes stayed capias. 

Defendant states he wishes to have counsel. Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. Court advises the Defendant he may apply for court appointed counsel if denied by the PD's office. Court advises the Defendant of his right to obtain private counsel. Court will set another hearing date for status of counsel.
Hearing on no contact order scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on no contact order on October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:20 AM Defendant Lewis H Sims-Brown not in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kinchloe. 

Case was scheduled for 9:30 am.

Court acknowledges receipt of letter request from the Defendant requesting adjournment of today's hearing. 
State requests capias and that bail be revoked and forfeited. 

Court will issue a capias, but stay it to the next hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Letter dated 08/12/2022, filed by Lewis H Sims-Brown, requesting an adjournment of the 08/15/2022 Hearing.

03:21 PM Defendant Lewis H Sims-Brown in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State has no objection to reinstating the signature bond.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

For Non-Appearance.
